original: Boren, Evert Joel, läroverksadjunkt, Falköping, f. 28/12/00 i S. Vånga, Älvsb. L, av Tomas B. o. Jenny Magnusson. G. 38 m. Gudrun Östberg. Barn: Linnar f. 39, Ingjerd o. Annika 43, Magnus 45. — Studrex. i Gbg 24, fil. mag. 30, provår v. södra latin i Sthlm 37. Res. t. Tyskl. 30, Norge 31 o. 32, Danm. 33. E. lär. i Sundsvall 30-31, Kristinehamn 32-33, Jön-köp. 33-34, vik. lektor v. Linköp. folk-sk:sem. 35, e. lär. i Jönköp. 35, vik. lektor v. Karlstads folkskisem. 36, e. ’lär. i Strängnäs 36, vik. lektor v. Linköp. folkskisem. 38, e. o. adj. i Strängnäs 38-39, adj. i modersm. o. tyska v. Falköp. samrealsk. sed. 39. Boréus, Nils Birger Einar, läroverksadjunkt, Göteborg, f. 8/9/88 i Skara av läroviadj. Karl Wilhelm B. o. Anny Wennberg. G. 14 m. Enia Håkansson. Barn: Sven-Einar f. 15, köpm., Gbg, Anny-Brita 23. — Stud:-ex. i Hälsingborg 07, fil. mag. i Lund 12, provår 13. E. lär. i Värnamo 11-12, i Skövde 12-13, i Lidköp. 14,^ v. Kungsh. lärov. i Sthlm 14-15, adj. i Norrköp. 14, adj. i biol. o. kemi v. h. a. 1. i Majorna i Gbg sed. 22, vik. rektor där 38-39, rektor v. Gbgs afton-gymn. sed. 40. Sekr. i Rädda barnen i Norrköp. 21-22, v. ordf. i Gbgs lär:-sällsk. sed. 39, deput:suppl. i Lärov :-lär. riksförb. 39, led. av Biolog, o. Geogr. fören. Medl. av Odd Fellow^. RVO 38.
translated:
Boren, Evert Joel, high school teacher, Falköping, b. 28/12/00 in S. Vånga, Älvsb. County, son of Tomas B. and Jenny Magnusson. Married in 1938 to Gudrun Östberg. Children: Linnar b. 1939, Ingjerd and Annika b. 1943, Magnus b. 1945. Studied at the University of Gothenburg in 1924, received a Master's degree in 1930, and spent a trial year at Södra Latin school in Stockholm in 1937. Traveled to Germany in 1930, Norway in 1931 and 1932, and Denmark in 1933. Was a teacher in Sundsvall from 1930-1931, Kristinehamn from 1932-1933, Jönköping from 1933-1934, substitute teacher at the Linköping folk school in 1935, regular teacher in Jönköping in 1935, substitute teacher at the Karlstad folk school in 1936, regular teacher in Strängnäs in 1936, substitute teacher at the Linköping folk school in 1938, regular and assistant teacher in Strängnäs from 1938-1939, and teacher of mother tongue and German at the Falköping secondary school since 1939.

Boréus, Nils Birger Einar, high school teacher, Gothenburg, b. 8/9/88 in Skara, son of high school teacher Karl Wilhelm B. and Anny Wennberg. Married in 1914 to Enia Håkansson. Children: Sven-Einar b. 1915, merchant in Gothenburg, and Anny-Brita b. 1923. He passed the high school exam in Helsingborg in 1907, received a Master's degree from Lund University in 1912 and spent a trial year at a school in 1913. Was a teacher in Värnamo from 1911-1912, Skövde from 1912-1913, Lidköping in 1914, taught at Kungsholmen Gymnasium in Stockholm from 1914-1915, was assistant teacher in Norrköping in 1914, and taught biology and chemistry at high school level in Majorna, Gothenburg, since 1922.  He was a substitute principal at the same school in 1938-1939 and a principal at the Gothenburg evening gymnasium since 1940. He was secretary of Save the Children in Norrköping from 1921-1922, vice president of the Gothenburg teacher's association since 1939, deputy representative in the National Association of High School Teachers in 1939, and a member of the Biology and Geography Association. He was a member of the Odd Fellows and conferred the Royal Order of the Seraphim in 1938.
